page.title: 14PRIMARY SCHOOLS
page.content: BAYNARD'S COUNTY PRIMARY SCHOOL In the education year 1984/5 there were seven teachers and 210 children.Along with the national trend the numbers are declining. The grounds are well landscaped.Grassy mounds built round the edge of the playing field help to disguise the fact there is a busy road running alongside.These mounds are covered with many varieties of trees. 1976 was one of the very hot summers and drought conditions prevailed.Hosepipes were banned but the school was given a special dispensation by the local water authority to water the trees in order to keep them alive.Fortunately this constant watering worked and only a few trees were lost.
